result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared S. Butterfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any treatment per agent.  Continue on with treatment recommendation per agent.  1 day credit if revoked.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jared S. Butterfield in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Dolch agrees and makes final statement.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
18 months Probation.  1 day credit if revoked.  
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Continue on with treatment recommended.  
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Motion hearing on February 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.
No contact w/CWTH and AML or their residence

Pre-trial conference on February 13, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Return date on February 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jared S. Butterfield appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/two victims CWTH & AML   in underlying case  or their residence  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
